div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: Global Impact STEM Academy is committed to providing a safe, connected learning environment during the COVID-19 crisis.

div.a: COVID-19 Crisis Guidance for CCP Students & Families

div.p: Please remember that we expect there will be issues. We are available to help families work through any potential complications that may arise and are prepared to offer grace when things don’t work out as planned. However, it is important to remember that this is how we are doing school for now, and that students are expected to be engaged and participate. If students put forth the effort to stay engaged and connect with their instructors when struggling, everyone will do fine. If we do not see engagement or submissions of work, we will actively work to reach out to those families.
Students need to remember – check email – both GISA and Clark State! This is in addition to Schoology.
Our instructors are awesome! I hope that you will appreciate their hard work and flexibility as much as I do. In addition, all of us here at Global Impact appreciate you and your flexibility as well.
Our goal is to create and maintain a routine so that our students are prepared to return to school with as little disruption as possible. - Joshua Jennings, Founding Director

div.p: Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,

Good Evening! As promised in my last update, we are now prepared to communicate some processes and procedures as we approach the final month of our school calendar. Some of this will be repetitive in what you see from instructors and your school administrators; however, these are important items worth repeating. In addition, I have included some new information for our Seniors and their families about our planned 2020 graduation ceremony.

Today, April 20, 2020, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that schools will remain closed throughout the remainder of the academic school year. Teaching and learning will continue remotely; however, the physical reporting to a school campus or building will not occur.

As stated in an earlier update from me, this is not an unexpected announcement. Also as stated in an earlier update, we will continue to follow our current board-approved calendar for the remainder of the year.
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,

Considering the circumstances that we find ourselves in as a school, I have to say that I have been extremely impressed with all who make up our GISA community! Our staff members, students and parents have all adapted and are making the best of a far from ideal situation. The projects, instruction, and assignments that our instructors have created are impressive. The work submitted by our students and their engagement is commendable and also reflects the commitment of all of their parents and/or guardians. Thank you for all that you continue to do!
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,
There is not much in the way the way of new developments to share this week; however, I wanted to take and opportunity to highlight a few items.

We have been and will continue to follow our board-approved calendar for the 2019/20 school year during the COVID-19 building closure. That means that there will be no school Friday, April 10th, or Monday, April 13th. Virtual classes will resume on Tuesday, April 14th. We will wait for further guidance from the state before addressing any calendar items after the May 1st closure date that the governor has directed.
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,

Ohio Governor Mike DeWine has announced that due to the ongoing COVID-19 crisis, he has ordered that all kindergarten through 12th grade schools remain closed through Friday, May 1st. He also went on to say that as we approach that May 1st date, they would reassess the situation in Ohio and make a determination on whether or not to continue the closures.

Based on news reports, many of us anticipated that this directive to extend the closure and continue with remote learning opportunities was going to happen. Our team has had a number of discussions as to our plan if this ended up being the case. We will continue with our current delivery of remote learning and support for Global Impact students and their families through this closure. In addition, our instructors will continue to meet remotely to assess what aspects of our remote learning platform are working well and what areas need to be revised. We appreciate the feedback of students and parents so we can ensure that this experience continues to be the best that it can under these circumstances.
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,

I realize that Spring Break may have not been what most of you anticipated it would be; however, I hope that you had the opportunity to spend some quality time with your family and had time to rest and relax. The staff at Global Impact is ready to get back to work with all of our students this week. I am looking forward to seeing what the instructors have developed over the past week. In addition, I am looking forward to what the students will accomplish this week and potentially in the weeks to come. Although this remote learning experience is not ideal, know that all of us at GISA are committed to providing the best experience possible with the resources available to us.
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,

A lot has happened in a week and it’s hard to believe that we have one full week behind us with our remote learning! Responding to an unprecedented event like this one is not easy for any organization. However, we feel extremely blessed that Global Impact was so uniquely positioned to respond to this as quickly as we did. It really comes down to the fact that innovation and inclusion are so much of who we are as a community.

Your demonstrated ability to adapt and respond to what we have asked you to do as a school is commendable. Your response to this situation makes all of us want to work that much harder. Keep up the great work! Our future is in great hands!
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,
I just wanted to share a brief update for today. Not much has changed and a lot of the information below is the same from previous days with a few additional items.

The building is closed to the public. If you need anything that is in the building, please call ahead or reach out to one of our administrators. After Spring break, building administrators will have a rotating daily schedule. However, it is important that you call ahead so we can be prepared to safely address your needs. No one will be in the building next week, March 23rd through March 27th.
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,

We have some additional updates and guidance to share with you from what we learned today. As I mentioned in yesterday’s update, the frequency or depth of these updates may become less, but we encourage all of you to read these updates closely and reach out to us with any questions that you may have.
This week we are learning from our mistakes and refining our delivery as we all adjust to remote learning. It is important to keep the positive energy going as we encourage one another.
Dear Global Impact STEM Academy Families,

We have transitioned to have all of our staff work remotely. This includes all of our support staff. The building will be closed to the public; however, if you need anything at the school, please call and leave a message and we will get back with.

What we learned today is that our attendance and participation is solid. Some things have been a bit messy and we are going to be refining our work every day. The biggest suggestion we can give is that students utilize Google Chrome as a browser instead of Safari. We are finding more success with Chrome in regards to conferencing apps as it relates to remote learning. In this same regard, we find that students will have more success using their laptop rather than their phone to connect.

p.a: CDC Stop the Spread of Germs
Coronavirus: What You Need to Know

div.p: Any events that were scheduled through May 1st have either been cancelled or postponed indefinitely. As we get additional guidance from state and local officials, we will work to communicate any and all event rescheduling.
GISA Jr. & Sr. Prom (April 18) - Postponed
GISA FFA Awards Program (April 22) - Postponed
FFA State Convention (April 30 - May 1) - Postponed

div.h3: + What is the current student schedule?
div.p: Students will not be in school from March 16th to April 3rd.
Students must sign into AET by 8AM each morning. Virtual schedules are posted via Schoology.
div.h3: + What if I'm having technology problems and/or are missing something I left at school (e.g. a charger)?
div.p: If a student has left anything at school such as a computer, charger, etc., we will have staff here at the building to let students in to pick up those items. In addition, if you need to pick up an instrument from the music department, you can do that as well. You can submit your College Credit Plus Intent Form by taking a picture of it and sending it to Dr. Pfister or scanning it or dropping it off.
We are compiling a list of tech support troubleshooting, which you can access here.

We are taking attendance and will be documenting absences and tardies as normal. If students have not logged in, we will send out phone calls asking about their absence. There is no reason that students should be absent, unless there is a legitimate medical issue. If students have any technical difficulties, they or a parent need to contact the school so we can address them.
div.h3: + How will this affect special education services?
div.p: Special Education Services will continue. Our Chief Academic Officer, Mrs. Truebenbach is working closely with our intervention specialist, and aids to ensure that we are servicing and meeting the needs of our students. These intervention specialists will be aggressively monitoring progress and working closely with the academic instructors to assess needs and provide supports.
div.h3: + How will this affect the guidance department?
div.p: Our school counselors are available for our students and parents. Both HS Counselor, Mrs. Clark and MS Counselor, Mr. Jones will be available by phone, and can also be contacted through email and Schoology. In addition, counselors will be periodically checking in with students through email and Schoology.
div.h3: + What if I don't have Internet access?
div.p: GISA has purchased hotspots for students to provide access to those who do not have it. We have worked hard to confirm a comprehensive list of students who will need these hotspots and will be reaching out to their families as soon as we have them delivered and configured.
div.h3: + What changes will be made to assessment?
div.p: We will alter our current assessment and grading processes to more of a traditional scale. However, there will continue to be the opportunity for resubmissions and revisions of student work. Some of the online programs that we currently utilize, such as MindPlay, will have grades associated with them based on students meeting the minimum time requirements.

Teachers will be actively engaged with students every day from 7:45 a.m. – 2:30 p.m. In addition, school administrators and office staff will be at school daily from 7:30 a.m. – 3:30 p.m. School will be closed March 21st through the 27th for Spring Break.
div.h3: + How will this affect College Credit Plus courses?
div.p: For any questions regarding college courses, please contact Dr. Pfister. Clark State courses that are offered in our building by our instructors will be held remotely. Please follow the virtual schedule for your grade level.
div.h3: + What do I do if I am in need of nutritional services?
div.p: There are many organizations working to serve food to all individuals. Please see overviews for Springfield City, Clark County, Champaign County, and Madison County.

The Ohio Department of Health opened a call center to answer questions from the public regarding coronavirus (COVID-19). The call center will be open 7 days a week from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and can be reached at 1-833-4-ASK-ODH (1-833-427-5634)﻿

h3.a: Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

div.p: List of the latest updates on CDC guidance regarding COVID-19.
This FAQ provides an overview of Ohio’s response to COVID-19 and schooling. The FAQ will be updated on a regular basis throughout the COVID-19 crisis.
As the possibility of continued distance learning emerges, parents/guardians are encouraged to explore the Spectrum’s offer for free access to Spectrum Broadband and Wi-Fi.
